comment:
I knew it all along.  I saw the change in his appearance but it was mostly his bodylanguage.  I thought how does one change so quickly?  This was not about aging as some at the time said to me.  I said no he seems unhappy around her and often nervous.  I at the time thought it was at least emotional abuse, she was definitely in charge and did not realise the extent.  When amber appeared that day with the bruises and the headline, I was confused and thought no something is not right here.  Her lank hair style also made me suspicious as that seemed contrived to me.  Also her expression.  It was like she had to dress the part.  It did not ring true for me.  I thought totally out of character for him and it made no sense to me.  I was in shock at first and then suspicious of this woman I really knew nothing about.   I at the time thought is this real, and thought she had possibly injured herself.  I did not know enough about her to believe she could go so far as to fake the marks.    When the police said nothing to answer to and this restraining order was dropped, I was glad they got divorced and I thought that is an end to it.  I said yes I am right nothing to answer for and yes my initial instincts were correct.  

I have never been a diehard fan but have known him for years and he always struck me as someone who was a bit shy, but sweet and had this inate softness about him.  I am a bit older than him and thought of him as an older sister might.  I did not have a crush on him ever as some fans do but did appreciate he had a beautiful face.  I just really liked his personality as he seemed pretty unique in the film industry, a bit of a square peg in a round hole, but he never came across as hard, or in any way violent.  He struck me as a slightly shy, funny and gentle man.   Hence my disbelief and confusion that first day when she appeared with that headline. 

I hardly knew Amber, she was just the person dating Johnny but I got this bad vibe about her when with him.  When I saw the practical joke with th car incident I for the first time saw her temper and a real mean side to her and at the time thought opposites must attract but thought why is he with her.  

When she continued to advocate as a victim publically that is when I got annoyed.  I thought Johnny struck me as the type who would want to let it all go and get on with his life but she continued to infer he was guilty, even though no charges been found or brought and I thought how can he tolerate this. I thought he cannot continue to remain silent and put up with this as she was continually damaging his reputation and I hoped he would finally speak out.  He initially kept quiet for his family, himself and his career and although I understood this I wanted him to speak up.

When he first started speaking up for himself, it all started to fit into place and I realised it was worse than I had first envisaged.  I was glad he finally spoke up to defend his name but the biggest shock was how the media and hollywood would treat him.  It was then  I really started to worry for him and feel anger at how he was being treated.  It was then that I started to feel passionate for his cause as a male domestic abuse victim.
The more they doubledowned twisting the facts, not reporting many of the facts and just continually doubling down to paint this picture of him to suit their narrative the more angry I got and sad for him having to deal with after having the courage to finally speak out.  I naively thought the media would be fair and show both sides and they would start to see  that he was a victim.  I thought this early on.  It is one thing a manipulative narcissist abusing another person but when the media jump on the bandwagon and do the same for an easy  target it is shameful that society has become so unfair and cruel to the victim.  I am so ashamed of how the media have behaved throughout.  

I am ashamed that so few who have known him a long time have not stood up out of fear for their own careers in defense of him.  Some have but all those who worked for a long time and praised him are nowhere to be seen.  The more facts that come out some are speaking up but not enough.  Fear for their careers saying nothing they are throwing him under the bus.  The mainstream media, the more these high status people will speak up, the more diffiicult it will be for said media to ignore his side of the story.  

My greatest fear is that Johnny's health will be affected by this continuous battle and he will become worn out and give up.  It must be so hard mentally to deal with the false judgements daily spread knowing you are innocent, bad enough for someone not famous, but to see those lies spread constantly in the public arena must be pretty devastating to deal with.  I know how I would feel in his position and I am not sure   I would be strong enough.

I hope he finally gets the justice he deserves and at least one main media outlet finally reports truthfully the whole picture.  I want to see the mainstream media  apologise or at least admit what has really been going on, report his side, report the facts and then hopefully others will follow.
I want to see those in Hollywood who have known him for years to have the guts to  speak out publicly in his defense.  I want Warner Bros and Disney to apologise to him (doubt that will happen) but one can dream.  I know all they are interested in is their bottom dollar and they do not care about a man's reputation.  

I want more and more people before they condemn him to do research with an open mind, no preconceptions, as even with all the facts coming out, many are still of the same opinion and clearly just follow the easy route of following main media and condemning him because he is a man   Men cannot be the victim in their minds.  Especially famous rich men it seems. 

I fear Johnny will not convince all even though truth is on his side, I blame the media and Hollywood for this.  Do a google search and there is nothing but her narrative.  I do admire though that he has stood up for himself as all abuse victims would like to do.  My respect for him has increased  month after month since he started to fight back.  I am a  woman and I recognise that there are many men out there who are victims of domestic abuse. I hope more speak out. I admire him now more as someone fighting for what is right than anything he has achieved in his career.  Man first actor second. I wish him well in his fight for the truth.  He deserves better from the world.

I hope the support he is gaining from his fans and also the general public who just see a man being treated unfairly will give him faith and strength to continue to fight to defend himself.  The more that support the easier it will be for him to continue the fight to clear his name.  Thank you everyone who supports him in his fight for the truth.  He really needs you all.

comment:
Johnny is guilty but he‚Äôs not that kind of cold, calculated, psychopathic abuser so it‚Äôs not obvious. Sober, he is kind and charming. He‚Äôs the kind of abuser that never sets out to harm their victim. He gets fucked up and loses his mind and lashes out in his drunken, high, blacked out rage. And she fights back which only makes it worse. But he has power, fame, and money for ruthless lawyers that he can use to his advantage. He has fooled a lot of you. Despite the fact that there is a shit ton of evidence against him. 

Judges have sharper minds and notice things you can‚Äôt. They also have experience dealing with these kinds of cases. Ideally, they have the ability to remain objective too and not be persuaded by fame. They know that witnesses trump anything that Johnny‚Äôs team has put forward. They know how to detect false allegations. They know that false allegations usually don‚Äôt have witnesses or corroborating texts that go back years. They know that it would be highly unlikely for an individual to plan to sabotage their own marriage from the beginning and know to text people after real arguments, and on just the right dates, to make a trail of evidence that coincides with the timing of apologetic texts from their boyfriend for being out of control and promising it will never happen again. 

For that to happen AND to have a whole group of people willing to go along with it over a period of years just so they can testify for you years later if and when your marriage goes down the drain, is even more unlikely. To also have a makeup artist lie about covering images on your face and also have recordings of the accused saying things like ‚Äòwe both got physical with ‚Äòeach other‚Äô, on top of everything else, and have it not be true, is almost impossible and so incredibly far fetched that no sensible judge will but into it.  

But let‚Äôs say someone was able to pull all that off somehow, they would be determined to take you to court and go for some sort of compensation. And during the divorce, they wouldn‚Äôt withdraw their request for spousal support. Not after everything they masterfully planned out. If it was all done for money, the accuser would not then date a billionaire and the soon to be richest man in the entire fucking world and then just dump him. Are you kidding me? No gold digger would dump Elon Musk. And someone smart enough to pull off such an elaborate stunt would be smart enough to know that attacking the most popular actor in Hollywood would be good for their career. 

Also, an innocent man would never sign a statement vouching that his ex did not lie. We know Johnny likes to smash things up and get into bar fights. What are the chances that while he is flying into a crazy rage and doing massive damage, that he is actually going to end up being the victim in the argument? Would a man who just lost the tip of his finger from his wife throwing a bottle, be preoccupied with using his bloody finger to write slut shaming messages on mirrors in his own blood? Or does that sound like a man who is in such a state of jealous rage that he has gone almost mad? 

I feel like none of you have really took the time to even consider that Johnny might be guilty, for long enough to really analyze the evidence and ask yourself these questions. You want Johnny to be innocent. I get that. It‚Äôs easy to pain the young, beautiful wife of a powerful, rich man as a gold digger and some sort of evil, manipulative seductress.
